content.raw: I'm ready to approve after my comments are addressed.
content.html: I'm ready to approve after my comments are addressed.

content.raw: Looks like a good candidate for using `urlparse` to avoid the chance of getting the URL syntax wrong.  Not strictly necessary here, but later.
content.html: Looks like a good candidate for using urlparse to avoid the chance of getting the URL syntax wrong. Not strictly necessary here, but later.

content.raw: Compare to `requests.codes.ok` instead of `200`?  Same question for all the comparisons in this file.
content.html: Compare to requests.codes.ok instead of 200? Same question for all the comparisons in this file.

content.raw:
Should we consider using [urlparse](http://docs.python.org/2/library/urlparse.html) for these URL manipulations?

I wouldn't change it now, but if it's a good idea, perhaps ticket it for the future.
content.html:
Should we consider using urlparse for these URL manipulations?

I wouldn't change it now, but if it's a good idea, perhaps ticket it for the future.

content.raw: Suggest changing the name of the function argument from `url` to `ip`.
content.html: Suggest changing the name of the function argument from url to ip.

content.raw:
To avoid a possible (though admittedly very unlikely) race condition in which the same temporary filename gets used in two places, we should tell `tempfile` to not delete the temporary file when it's closed:

        tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False)
content.html:
To avoid a possible (though admittedly very unlikely) race condition in which the same temporary filename gets used in two places, we should tell tempfile to not delete the temporary file when it's closed:

    tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False)

content.raw: `temporal` -> `temporary`
content.html: temporal -> temporary

content.raw: Does this mean that we only ever bootstrap a CloudSim-stable?  If so, that's fine.  Just verifying that that is the intent.
content.html: Does this mean that we only ever bootstrap a CloudSim-stable? If so, that's fine. Just verifying that that is the intent.

content.raw: Why is the package version embedded in the code like this? It's sure to get out of date. If the code needs the version, it should read it from data file.
content.html: Why is the package version embedded in the code like this? It's sure to get out of date. If the code needs the version, it should read it from data file.

update.title: create_cloudsim fix

content.raw:
Specially, doc is more useful in python where the type of the parameters and returned values are implicit. Something brief is not so bad.

We could follow this [convention](http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/).
content.html:
Specially, doc is more useful in python where the type of the parameters and returned values are implicit. Something brief is not so bad.

We could follow this convention.

content.raw: I don't agree that all functions should have docstring. I'm not saying that we have enough right now either. Lets ask the others.
content.html: I don't agree that all functions should have docstring. I'm not saying that we have enough right now either. Lets ask the others.

content.raw: It looks good to me, besides two minor comments. As a side note, I believe our code would improve a lot if we start to become strict with the docstring. I'd suggest to write a description for every function, as well as a brief description of its arguments and what type is required.
content.html: It looks good to me, besides two minor comments. As a side note, I believe our code would improve a lot if we start to become strict with the docstring. I'd suggest to write a description for every function, as well as a brief description of its arguments and what type is required.

content.raw:
I'm not sure about the print.
If I'm not wrong the launch_constellation will execute _api_post(), that may raise an exception or return r.json(). I'd suggest to capture the exception to be able to launch the rest of baby cloudsims and only print an error message if the returned code represents a fail (or the exception is raised).
content.html: I'm not sure about the print. If I'm not wrong the launch_constellation will execute _api_post(), that may raise an exception or return r.json(). I'd suggest to capture the exception to be able to launch the rest of baby cloudsims and only print an error message if the returned code represents a fail (or the exception is raised).

content.html:
I'm not sure about the print.

If I'm not wrong the launch_constellation will execute _api_post(), that may raise an exception or return r.json(). I'd suggest to capture the exception to be able to launch the rest of baby cloudsims and only print an error message if the returned code represents a fail (or the exception is raised).
